text: HackerRank | Prepare Certify Compete Apply Search   1  All Contests SRBD Code Contest - 2023 (Round 1) Bright Birthday  Bright Birthday locked Problem Submissions Time Limit ++ Memory Limit Bivas received a colorful gift for his birthday. It is a string of lowercase English letters. He is delighted and wants to brighten up his room using it. He knows a set of colors which consists of names of diﬀerent colors. The set is ﬁxed and showed below. "blue", "green", "yellow", "red", "purple", "orange", "pink", "grey", "cyan", "brown", "ash", "silver", "gold", "white", "black" . Now he wishes to use some of the characters from to make diﬀerent colors and decorate his room on his special day. He wants to choose a subset of such that all the colors from that subset can be made from using each character of at most once. All the colors he wishes must be created simultaneously and he cannot use one instance of a character in creating diﬀerent colors of the chosen subset. Refer to the sample explanation for further clarity. You need to help Bivas ﬁnd the maximum possible size of the desired subset. Input Format The ﬁrst line contains an integer denoting the number of test cases. Then follow lines each consisting of the string for a test case. Constraints Output Format For each testcase print the answer in a separate line. Sample Input 0 3 bluehatesred dergey nothing Sample Output 0 3 1 0 Explanation 0 First testcase: You can make the colors "blue", "ash" and "red" together. Second testcase: You can either make "grey" or "red", but not both of them together.  Interview Prep | Blog | Scoring | Environment | FAQ | About Us | Support | Careers | Terms Of Service | Privacy Policy | Submissions: 639 Max Score: 1 Rate This Challenge: More         Test against custom input  ⚙C  Line: 1 Col: 1 Run Code Submit CodeUpload Code as File #include <stdio.h> #include <string.h> #include <math.h> #include <stdlib.h> int main() {    /* Enter your code here.
